data.title: Power Pop!
data.meta_description: Musikken som burde ligge på alle hitlister, men som få har hørt.
data.text:
Bandene som forener det beste fra The Beatles og The Who.

De er alle håpløse når det gjelder image og markedsføring og dermed dømt til å bli nerdenes favoritt band.

Snakker du med en fra menigheten vil du garantert blir anbefalt noen av disse bandene:

The Raspberries, Big Star, Badfinger, The Knack, The Shoes, Rooks, Rubinoos, Chris von Sneidern, The Beat (US), Pagliaro, Jack Lee, Wackers, The Last, Dwight Twilley, 20/20, The Plimsouls, The Nerves, Marshall Crenshaw, The dB’s, The Bongos, Pezband, Nick Lowe, Elvis Costello, Cotton Mather, Emitt Rhodes, Matthew Sweet, Jellyfish, Material Issue, Velvet Crush, Posies, Redd Kross, The Rosenbergs, Tommy Keene, The Flamin’ Groovies, The Romantics, Todd Rundgren, Cheap Trick, The Records, The Wondermints, Brendan Benson, Game Theory, The Windbreakers, Paley Brothers, The Jags, The Lambrettas, The Scruffs, Gary Valentine, Let’s Active, Gigolo Aunts, Chris Bell, Jason Falkner, Fountains of Wayne, The LA’s, The Smithereens, Teenage Fanclub, The Barracudas, DM3, The Someloves, Richard X Heyman, The Chevelles, The Cheepskates, Imperial Drag, Sloan, The Toms, Greg Kihn, The Merrymakers, The Shazam, P.Hux, Micheal Guthrie Band, Incredible Kidda Band, Seth Swirsky, Beagle, Utopia, Wanderlust, Bill Lloyd, Bram Tchaikovsky, The Myracle Brah, The Beatifics, Van Duren, The Sneetches, The Orange Humble Band, XTC, Squeeze, The Moberleys, Fotomaker, Jim Basnight, Blue Ash, Three Hour Tour, The Patriots, The Shivvers, Artful Dodger, Milk ‘n’ Cookies, Ian Gomm, Rockpile, The Wannadies, Kyle Vincent, Nick Gilder, Walter Clevenger, The Motors, The Chords, The Mockers, The Boys, Flying Color, The Jets, The Vandalias, Eric Carmen, Chris Stamey, Peter Holsapple, Phil Seymour…

Hva er Power Pop ?

Dette sa Pete Townshend i et intervju fra 1967: “Power pop is what we play—what the Small Faces used to play, and the kind of pop The Beach Boys played in the days of ‘Fun, Fun, Fun’ which I preferred. You know, raw rock & roll with la-la-las."

Raspberries – Go All The Way

Når jeg selv skal beskrive musikken blir jeg aldri helt enig med meg selv, er dette for mye pop eller er det for rocka, men ingredienser som kule 12 strengede Rickenbackere og Vox forsterkere, bra koring og Beach Boy harmonier, håndklapping og tamburiner blir aldri feil og MELODIER.

Det skal være riff, fengende melodier med karakter og kraft, harmonier og tekstene skal helst handle om «girls, or summer, or girls in summer, or cars, or getting drunk»…Og låtene bør ikke være mye lengre enn 2 minutter…

Big Stars låt September Gurls ble engang beskrevet som: “Innocent, but deadly” og dette er kanskje kjernen av det hele.

Om Beatles med Lennons power og McCartneys pop er din musikk vil du garantert finne noen perler i denne Spotifylisten Power Pop

For mer lesing anbefales John Boracks – Shake Some Action: The Ultimate Power Pop Guide som du selvfølgelig kan låne på biblå, sammen med det du kan tenke deg av mer eller mindre obskure CD som du kan utforske videre.

Her er noen av mine favorittlåter:

‘Just A Chance’ – Badfinger, from Wish You Were Here (Warner Bros Records, 1974)

‘Someday, Someway’ – Marshall Crenshaw, from Marshall Crenshaw (Warner Bros, 1982)

‘Let Her Dance’ – The Bobby Fuller Four, from KRLA King Of The Wheels (Del Fi, 1965)

‘Something Else’ – Eddie Cochran, single (United Artists, 1959)

‘A Million Miles Away’ – The Plimsouls, from Everywhere At Once (1983)

‘For You’ – Greg Kihn, from Greg Kihn Again (Beserkely, 1977)

‘Do Anything You Wanna Do’ – Eddie & The Hot Rods, single (Island, 1977)

‘Come Out And Play’ – The Paley Brothers, from The Paley Brothers (Sire, 1978)

‘Sixteen Again’ – The Buzzcocks, from Love Bites (Liberty, 1978)

‘I’ll Be There For You’ – The Rembrandts, from Untitled (Atlantic, 1992)

‘I Remember You’ – The Ramones, from Leave Home (Sire, 1977)

‘Kid’ – The Pretenders, from Pretenders (Sire, 1980)

‘High School’ – The MC5, from Back In The USA (Atlantic, 1970)

‘Miss Understanding’ – Jason Falkner from Presents Author Unknown (Elektra, 1996)

‘Saturday Night’ – Bay City Rollers, single (Bell, 1976)

‘Giving It All’ – 20/20, single (Bomp, 1978)

‘That’s What She Said’ – The Greenberry Woods, from Rapple Dapple (Sire, 1994)

‘Rest Up’ – Jim Basnight, single (Big Deal, 1993)

‘No Matter What’/’Jet’ – Jellyfish, from Bellybutton (Special Edition) (Virgin, 1990)

‘Waiting For The Night’ – The Pop, from Go (Arista, 1979)

‘Hanging On The Telephone’ – The Nerves, from The Nerves EP (Nerves, 1977)

‘Reasons’ – The Rooks, from The Rooks (Guardian, 1994)
